Title: Human Resources Administrator
Job Description:
Handles the administrative management of Human Resources at his site(s) in accordance with the Group rules and the regulations in force.
Handles all aspects of the administrative management of personnel, from when employees join the company to when they leave.
Performs administrative tasks and follow-up (letters and emails, certificates, invitations, dashboards, reports, etc.) in accordance with Group rules.
Recruitment
Manages temporary and permanent employee orders
Prepares advertising campaigns, on-line postings, and manages the applicant tracking and on-boarding software (ADP Workforce Now)
Screens and interviews applicants, makes employment offers, performs background & reference checks
Maintains staffing models, drafts and manages new employee paperwork, as well as recruiting and retention metrics and dashboards
Training
Provides for new employee orientation to include safety and benefits introduction
Sets up Electronic Personnel Files and provides for input of initial hire data to HRIS system via the Onboard system and Manage Documents
Creates time and security badges & informs employees of the use
Payroll & Benefits
Is proficient in both payroll and benefits software (ADP Workforce Now) in order to provide assistance to and back up of Payroll and/or Benefits Specialist as needed
May Assist with Leave Administration – Unemployment, FMLA, S/T and L/T Disability Claims
Assists with planning and deploying employee events and recognition
Desired Qualifications and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or Human Resource Management with 2-5 years of experience in Human Resources – preferably a manufacturing environment (including practical experience in recruiting, benefits, & payroll).
Will consider a 2 year or non-degree professional with 5+ years of applicable HR experience
Professional Abilities and Skills:
Highly developed interpersonal communication skills, discretion, approachability and a strong sense of equity, confidentiality, self-discipline and organization
Detail Oriented, Trustworthy, Creative Problem Solver with a desire to work as a team with colleagues
Proficiency in desktop applications and knowledge of payroll software (ADP) and the Office suite.
Technical Knowledge:
Previous knowledge and application of U.S. employment laws desirable i.e.: FLSA, FMLA, ADA, ERISA, EEO etc.

Title: HR Manager
Job Description:
About us
Located in Vista, Southern California, ZETTLER Group North America offers application-engineering, sales, distribution, and customer service for a wide variety of top-quality electronic components, catering to demanding customers in both industrial and consumer applications. Our diversified product lines are designed to provide complete solutions for component applications across a broad spectrum of industries.
We have an exciting opportunity for a strong, enthusiastic, and driven, HR Manager to join our Zettler family.
We believe that each employee contributes directly to the growth and success of Zettler Group. Our employees have been the basis of our success and are the foundation of our future. As we continue to grow as an organization, you can expect a challenging, enjoyable, and rewarding opportunity to develop both professionally and personally. Explore the possibilities with us and join our growing culture.
Job Summary
The HR Manager will report to the Controller of Zettler Group North America and will be responsible for day-to-day HR activities, including but not limited to payroll, benefits management, talent acquisition, employee relations, and compliance.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with Federal/State labor laws and regulations.
Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, policies, and procedures across organization, including updating policies, and employee handbook.
All aspects of payroll processing, administration, and reporting.
Maintain and update all employee records in HRIS system, ADP Workforce Now.
Partner with managers to understand and execute the organization’s current and future talent needs, and retention.
Develop and manage talent acquisition process, which includes, recruitment, screening, interviewing, and hiring of qualified job applicants while collaborating with departmental managers to understand skills and competencies required for openings.
Develop and manage onboarding and new hire orientation process. Educate newly hired employees on HR policies, internal procedures, and regulations.
Support and guide managers on performance management, including employee performance evaluations, identifying, and rewarding employee success, advancement opportunities, promotions and compensation recommendations to establish a high-performance culture.
Analyze compensation, benefit, and workplace trends and metrics in partnership with company leadership to develop solutions, programs, and policies.
Conduct job analysis to modify or create new or existing job descriptions.
Nurture a positive work environment in alignment with companies’ open-door policy.
Participate in the development, preparation, and implementation of employee engagement activities and company events, including budget approvals.
Comply, understand, and promote safety and wellness programs to ensure a safe and healthy work environment.
Provide COVID-19 support and guidance in accordance with CDC (Centers for Disease Control) and CDPH (California Dept of Health), and CalOSHA regulations.
Support and guide managers on employee relation concerns and disciplinary/corrective actions through investigations and assisting with mediation efforts as appropriate to create positive outcomes and resolve complex employee relation grievances and conflicts.
Provide support and guidance for employees and managers on all HR related questions and matters.
Participate in full cycle termination process, such as preparing related documentation, conducting exit interviews to determine reasons behind separations, and ensuring legal risks are mitigated.
Manage all company benefits as appropriate, including 401K, COBRA, new hire/open enrollment, floating holidays, PTO, and process all monthly health and welfare bills.
Maintain a high level of confidentiality concerning business operations, compensation, employee information, and all other business practices.
Supervisory Responsibilities
Oversee and manage the Administration department; plan, organize and control all activities of the department.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
A self-starter and problem solver
Thorough knowledge of HR principles and federal/local regulations
Experience in implementing and administering performance programs and trainings
Must have demonstrated success in recruiting and retaining employee talent, including creating and implementing recruitment strategies
Excellent ability to multi-task and prioritize in a busy, fast-paced environment
Exhibit extraordinary discretion, flexibility, and willingness to work closely with our leadership team
Ability to manage multiple HR tasks while meeting required deadlines
Track record of being well-organized, having an eye for detail, prioritizing daily tasks and adjusting to changing business needs
Excellent active listening and people skills
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel and Power Point is essential
Qualifications and Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or PHR/SHRM-CP certification preferred
A minimum of six years related HR experience, at least three years in a management role
Broad generalist background including coaching and counseling, performance management, employee involvement, team building, as well as compensation and benefits
Prior experience with ADP Workforce Now HRIS system
Strong proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) with emphasis on Excel spreadsheets.
Additional Information/Employee Benefits
Medical (Nine plans to choose from, 75% contribution toward employee premium, 50% contribution toward dependent premium - Eligibility: First of the month following date of hire.)
Dental
Vision
Life / AD&D
Long Term Disability
FSA/Dependent Care
Retirement Plan
PTO/Sick time
Floating Holidays
Seven Paid Holidays
Employee Assistance Program
Tuition Reimbursement
Learn more by visiting our website: https://www.zettlerusa.com/
In-office Schedule: Monday - Friday, 7:30 AM - 4:15 PM
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $80,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year

Job Description:

You’ll ensure the necessary support is also provided to commanders across all branches. You’ll be trained in document preparation, drafting requests, and overseeing official documentation, such as ID cards and tags. You’ll also learn computer programs that keep personnel data up to date.

Title: Human Resources Generalist
Job Description:
HAVENWYCK HOSPITAL (a UHS facility)
Havenwyck Hospital is a 243 bed Joint Commission accredited and licensed psychiatric hospital in Auburn Hills, Michigan. We specialize in providing comprehensive, compassionate behavioral health services to children, adolescents and adults.
For more information, please visit us at www.havenwyckhospital.com.
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Human Resources Generalist is responsible for full cycle recruiting (including sourcing candidates through various channels), employee engagement, conducting New Hire Orientation, employment onboarding, records management and data integrity, unemployment correspondence, tracking employee in-services, and other duties as assigned. Additionally, the HR Generalist may be responsible for the HealthStream training system (assigning annual training modules to existing & new hire employees).
JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Associates degree with at least ten years of Human Resources Generalist experience required. Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Minimum of two years of HR Recruiter experience, including full cycle of recruiting and on-boarding new hire employees required, healthcare experience is preferred.
Experience mediating employee concerns and exercising sound professional judgment to make recommendations in the best interest of the Hospital and its employees required.
Knowledge of Joint Commission and other federal, state and local laws and regulations that govern healthcare required.
Excellent customer service skills are required. Must possess superb problem solving and multi tasking skills with effective communicate skills, both verbally and in writing.
Must have the skill set to work in a fast-paced environment with frequent interruptions.
Excellent computer skills required. Must be proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook applications.
Three – five years of HR Generalist experience in a healthcare setting preferred.
WHAT DO OUR CURRENT EMPLOYEES VALUE AT HAVENWYCK HOSPITAL AND UHS?
An environment that puts patient care first. One of the most rewarding aspects of this job is providing excellent care, comfort, and security to the patients and families you treat, at their most vulnerable times. Supportive and responsive leadership. You are never alone, as you are part of a large network of peer co-workers that routinely exchange ideas and review current topics within the industry. Having the opportunity to grow, learn, and advance in your career. There are very robust continuing education options and opportunities for skills diversification and career advancement with UHS.
BENEFIT HIGHLIGHTS:
Challenging and rewarding work environment
Competitive Compensation & Generous Paid Time Off
Excellent Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Plan
401(K) with company match and discounted stock plan
Career development opportunities within UHS and its 300+ Subsidiaries
Free Basic Life Insurance
Tuition Reimbursement
SoFi Student Loan Refinancing Program
Universal Health Services (UHS)
One of the nation’s largest and most respected providers of hospital and healthcare services, Universal Health Services, Inc. has built an impressive record of achievement and performance. Growing steadily since its inception into an esteemed Fortune 500 corporation, annual revenues were $11.6 billion in 2020. In 2021, UHS was again recognized as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune; in 2020, ranked #281 on the Fortune 500; and listed #330 in Forbes ranking of U.S.’ Largest Public Companies. Headquartered in King of Prussia, PA, UHS has 89,000 employees and through its subsidiaries operates 26 acute care hospitals, 334 behavioral health facilities, 39 outpatient facilities and ambulatory care access points, an insurance offering, a physician network and various related services located in 38 U.S. states, Washington, D.C., Puerto Rico and the United Kingdom. Hospital is a Joint Commission-accredited and licensed psychiatric hospital in Auburn Hills, Michigan. We specialize in providing comprehensive, compassionate behavioral health services to children, adolescents and adults.
EEO Statement
All UHS subsidiaries are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates. UHS subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and as such, openly support and fully commit to recruitment, selection, placement, promotion and compensation of individuals without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), genetic information, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
We believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success.
Notice
At UHS and all its subsidiaries, our Human Resources departments and recruiters are here to help prospective candidates by matching skillset and experience with the best possible career path at UHS and our subsidiaries. We take pride in creating a highly efficient and best in class candidate experience. During the recruitment process, no recruiter or employee will request financial or personal information (Social Security Number, credit card or bank information, etc.) from you via email. Additionally, recruiters will not email you from a public webmail client like Hotmail, Gmail, Yahoo Mail, etc. If you are suspicious of a job posting or job-related email mentioning UHS or its subsidiaries, let us know by contacting our Compliance Hotline at: https://uhs.alertline.com or 1-800-852- 3449.'

Title: Human Resource Business Partner I
Job Description:
Requisition ID:
36105
Work Location:
Human Resources - Municipal Center
Pay Range:
A.9, $52,441 - $81,284
Starting Salary:
Minimum of the Pay Range
Work Schedule:
8- 5 pm M-F
Part Time Hours/Wk:

1/26/22
Application Deadline:
Job Duties:
Human Resource Business Partner I/II - This position may be filled as a Human Resource Business Partner I or Human Resource Business Partner II depending on the qualifications of the selected candidate.
The City of Virginia Beach seeks a business minded HR professional to add to our growing Employee Relations team. The HR Business Partner role is responsible for supporting assigned departments with their employee relations needs, providing technical expertise and exceptional customer service. This position involves all things policy, compliance, case work, and coaching. If you enjoy self directed work, and have a passion for problem solving, this is the position for you.
Human Resource Business Partner I (Pay Range: A.9, $52,441 - $81,284 DOQ) Click here for the job description
Human Resource Business Partner II (Pay Range: A11 $57,817 - $89,616 DOQ) Click here for the job description
Key duties of this position include but are not limited to:
Independently perform multifaceted professional duties
Provide a variety of support and counsel to managers and supervisors on disciplinary matters
Conduct workplace investigations and draft investigative reports, grievability determinations and other professional documents in compliance with City policy and applicable laws or regulations
Consult with supervisors and employees and formulate recommendations regarding appropriate courses of action for a variety of employee relations issues (e.g., absence management, grievance, performance management)
Establish and maintain collaborative working relationships throughout the organization
Interpret policies and procedures for supervisors and employees.
Collaborate with City employees, and supervisors regarding absence management (e.g., FML, leave donation, LWOP) and requests for accommodations pursuant to the Americans with Disabilities Act
Coordinate and lead projects or programs
Research, analyze and formulate statistical and narrative reports as well as final recommendations regarding HR-related issues/programs to provide a basis for decision making and accountability
This posting will be Open Until Filled; however, a first review of candidate submissions will be completed one week after posting and weekly thereafter.
Special Instructions:
Please complete the application in its entirety. The application is the primary required document used to screen qualifications and years of experience. A resume does not replace a completed application. Be sure you are thorough in describing your skills and duties as you complete the work experience section. If the information cannot be verified, you will not receive credit.
Please provide a copy of any certifications or related professional licenses.

This position offers a remote/hybrid work schedule arrangement and career progression opportunity.

Some positions may require employee to have, or obtain, a current and valid drivers license.

Some positions may require employee to have, or obtain , a current and valid Virginia or North Carolina driver’s license in accordance with Virginia or North Carolina DMV driver’s license eligibility requirements.

Experience applying state and federal laws related to employee relations including EEO, FLSA, FMLA, ADA
Ability to develop collaborative working relationships with a variety of stakeholders and to maintain a professional demeanor at all times
Skill in communicating and interacting with diverse populations on complex matters with concision, both orally and in writing
Experience developing and presenting training offerings and other presentations
SHRM or HRCI certifications are preferred, but not required
Public sector experience is preferred, but not required.

Title: Payroll/HR Generalist
Company: The Wellsville Group dba Ashley HomeStore
Job Description:
The Wellsville Group dba Ashley HomeStore is hiring
Payroll/HR Generalist - HRBP, Syracuse/Rochester Market
We are one of the largest operators of Ashley HomeStore retail locations in the United States with 20 locations throughout New York, Ohio & Pennsylvania.
Humble, Helpful, and Thankful are some of the words that describe the team members working within our GROWING family oriented company.
Leader, Motivator, and Mentor are the words that should describe you.
The Wellsville Group dba Ashley HomeStore has an exciting opportunity for a Payroll/HR Generalist (HRBP) to oversee the company's Syracuse/Rochester Region. The main focus is to create an environment with the goal of becoming an employer of choice. Involvement in all aspects of HR department including caring for our team members, strategic initiatives & the growth & development of self & others. This position serves as a payroll processor back-up on an as needed basis. If you are looking to grow & expand your HR experience & exposure, this might be the right fit for you.
**Please note, this position "offices" out of one of our Ashley HomeStore retail locations in Syracuse (Liverpool or Camillus). The region includes Batavia, Rochester, Horseheads, Camillus & Liverpool locations. Occasional day travel will be required.
Essential Functions:
Support & promote the company’s Vision, Mission & Value statements
Actively assist & participate in the development & training of team members
Continuously review & improve HR processes, including onboarding & introduction of new team members
Collaborates & establishes strong relationships with all leadership in market area
Heavily involved in team member relations & onboarding procedures in alignment with company culture
Conducts or assists with new hire orientation, audits new hire paperwork to ensure all documents are received & in compliance
Collaborate with talent acquisition team to gain a comprehensive understanding of the company’s present & future hiring needs through succession planning
Conducts or assists with reviewing applications, background & reference checks
Participates in on-site interviews
Coordinate LOA (leave of absence) & tracking for all locations within market
Maintains accurate & up-to-date human resource files, records & documentation
Answers frequently asked questions from team members & applicants relative to standard policies, benefits, HR processes etc.; refers more complex questions to appropriate HR staff or management
Conducts or assists with record audits & mandatory reports; I-9 audits, EEO-1 filings, payroll audits & other compliance reviews
Provides support as needed with respect to vendors, such as disability carriers
Prepares documentation when needed to respond to inquiries &/or requests for information
Stay up to date on employment legislation & enforce them within the company
Additional Responsibilities:
Acts as a role model within & outside company, maintains a positive & respectful attitude, communicates effectively during interactions
Demonstrates flexible & efficient time management & ability to prioritize workload
Assists with planning & execution of special events such as benefits enrollment, organization-wide meetings, team member recognition events, holiday parties & retirement celebrations
Performs other duties as assigned
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
Ability to be highly productive in an autonomous environment with the ability to ask for guidance when needed
Excellent organizational skills & attention to detail
Proficient with Microsoft Word & Excel
Adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands & can deal with frequent change
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to manage sensitive & confidential situations with tact, professionalism & diplomacy
Strong grammar skills with written & spoken vocabulary
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Employee assistance program
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Application Question(s):
Do you have reliable transportation?
This position "offices" out of either the Camillus or Liverpool retail Ashley HomeStore. The region covered by this partner includes Rochester, Batavia, Horseheads & Syracuse. Are you willing & able to travel to these locations?

Bachelor's (Required)
Experience:
Human resources: 2 years (Preferred)
ADP Workforce Now payroll & benefits: 2 years (Preferred)

25% (Preferred)

Title: Onsite HR Talent Consultant
Job Description:
AVIMOE: We help you take care of the people who take care of your business

At Avimoe we take pride in developing our team members. Energy, excitement, initiative, and motivation are the key skills we look for when growing our team. Through mentorship, teamwork & training we provide an opportunity for you to grow and develop your skills in a manner that will elevate your professional career. This is a great opportunity for candidates interested in Customer Service and Human Resources.

The Onsite Talent Consultant at Avimoe will run the daily functions of managing client and associate relations, including hiring, interviewing and placement of associates, and enforcing company policies and practices.

This is a full time, in office position. The position is located in Beloit, KS.

Candidate must be within reasonable commuting distance at the time of hire.

Responsibilities:
Recruits, interviews, and facilitates the hiring of qualified job applicants for open positions; collaborates with clients to understand skills and competencies required for openings.
Conducts or acquires background checks and employee eligibility verifications.
Executes new hire onboarding.
Oversee the scheduling, assignments, and daily workflow of associates assigned to various clients.
Handles employment-related inquiries from applicants, candidates, associates, and clients, referring complex and/or sensitive matters to the appropriate staff.
Participates in all injury investigations.
Executes employee disciplinary meetings, terminations, and investigations.
Maintains compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; reviews policies and practices to maintain compliance.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Required Skills/Abilities:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal and conflict resolution skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
Must use ATS proficiently and consistently to document all activity.
Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn applicant-tracking software or other recruitment systems.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field required.
Note: Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Title: Human Resources Assistant
Job Description:
Hi. We're GetInsured, the market leader in SaaS-based state-based health insurance exchanges (the fastest-growing segment of health insurance delivery). In other words, we help people get insured millions, in fact. While our mission has always been to make finding and enrolling in health insurance simple, our vision has grown. We're expanding our pioneering SaaS model to public health and safety net services, not just state health insurance platforms. That means there are millions more across the country that we can have an impact on. As our vision grows, so does our team. We're looking for people who are passionate about what they do to join our crew comprised of founders, technology leaders, former exchange directors, CIOs, and policy staff, to name a few.
What we offer
Positions within the company that allow you to make an immediate impact. Our teams are reshaping rapidly growing and evolving market segments. You will ultimately help craft the company's next success story. We're a well-funded and stable private company. GetInsured is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Opportunity to work remotely
A knowledgeable, dedicated, and experienced team
Health, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability
401k match
Stock options
Yearly Education allowance
Charitable contribution matching
A competitive base salary (geography/location and experience may impact compensation)
GetInsured is looking for a Human Resources Assistant to join our corporate team. The HR Assistant will assist HR with Administrative duties.
Responsibilities
Maintains accurate and up-to-date human resource files, records, and documentation.
Answers frequently asked questions from applicants and employees relative to standard policies, benefits, hiring processes, etc.; refers more complex questions to appropriate senior-level HR staff or management.
Maintains the integrity and confidentiality of human resource files and records.
Performs periodic audits of HR files and records to collect and file all required documents appropriately.
Provides clerical support to the HR department.
Assists with planning and execution of special events such as benefits enrollment, organization-wide meetings, employee recognition events, holiday parties, and retirement celebrations.
Facility-related needs (ordering supplies, calling for vendor repairs, etc.)
Performs other duties as assigned
Skills/Experience Required
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to manage sensitive and confidential situations with tact, professionalism, and diplomacy.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
Proficient with or able to quickly learn human resource information systems (HRIS), and similar computer applications.
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines

Title: Associate Human Resources Generalist
Job Description:
The Associate Human Resources Generalist is here t o support business areas by assisting line managers in the delivery of people management processes. Provide a professional administrative service, to employees, line managers and the wider HR team in all transactional aspects of employee lifecycle events. To provide expert and commercially sound advice and guidance on all transactional employee lifecycle events. Support to HR Business Partner.

What You'll Be Doing:
Work at all times to Company Policies and Procedures and within the administrative function. Work flexibly across the HR department and provide cover and assistance for other HR team as required.

Provide knowledgeable and commercially balanced guidance and advice on HR policies and procedures to line managers which are in line with Company policy and legislations; ensuring the best practice is adhered to at all times.

Establish key relationships and work with line managers to ensure effective management of employee lifecycle events; coaching and influencing where required and working to raise line manager capability in managing employee lifecycle events. Escalate situations as appropriate as well as capability themes to the HR Business Partner.

Establish key relationships between Employees, Managers and Directors to ensure compliance with Company policies, Federal, State and Local regulations and the completion of employees’ personnel records.

Take instruction from any of the following; HR SVP, HR Business Partners on any required administration to support specific ER cases.

Provide administrative support for HR team in the delivery of significant organizational projects and one off activities.

Act as back-up to p roactively check and challenge the accuracy of information provided before entering into ADP and SAP

Serve as back-up for HRSC team and assist with duties as needed.

Follow up on missing data; help track relevant HR metrics

Run and provide standard reports as required

Participate in systems testing and escalate systems and process issues to the HRBPs

Respond to queries escalated from the HR Service team

Highlight and escalate any process improvements which would deliver an improved service and/or enable greater efficiency

Research and provide knowledgeable guidance and advice on HR policies, I-9 issues and new hire procedures to managers which are in line with Company policy and legislation; ensuring that best practice is adhered to at all times.

Act as a brand ambassador at all times – specifically when working with external providers

Take responsibility for all necessary documentation and administrative follow up for ER caseload working with the HR Generalists to ensure delivery

Work at all times to Company Policies and Procedures and within the administrative guidelines. Pro-actively identify opportunities for process improvement and raise accordingly.

Serve as the back-up for Unemployment process. Work with outside vendor to ensure that all cases are properly coded and responded to. Work with line managers on appeal and hearing. Keep comprehensive database of all unemployment claims and charges. Work with outside vendor to ensure proper billing and support.

Assist with Immigration cases from state to finish. Work with outside legal counsel to ensure that all cases are handled properly and efficiently. Work with impacted employees to manage expectations and ensure they understand the process. Complete all paperwork, applications and requirements in a timely fashion within deadlines to ensure best chance for Visa approval.

Act as main resource and company representative to all employees during their employment life cycle . Serve as internal customer service for our employment base. Provide direct one on one check in meetings for corporate employees upon 6 months and one year of hire.

What You'll Bring With You:
2+ years of experience working in an HR capacity.

Bachelor’s Degree in HR, Business Administration or related area preferred

Best practice HR processes and procedures and all existing policies and associated administration

Some knowledge of federal, state and local laws preferred

Knowledge of Unemployment and Immigration processes and laws

Experience in a distribution environment highly welcomed, preferably in an environment where confidentiality is paramount

Operated as an HR Assistant, or similar role preferred

Ability to follow through on deliverables and meet objectives and deadlines

Ability to take initiative and work independently

About Clarks

Clarks, based in Somerset, England, has been at the forefront of innovative shoemaking since its foundation in 1825, when brothers James and Cyrus Clark made a slipper from sheepskin off-cuts. At the time it was ground-breaking: a combination of invention and craftsmanship that has remained at the heart of what the brand does now. In the Clarks archive of more than 22,000 pairs are shoes that have sparked revolutions and defined generations. From the original Clarks Desert Boot, first designed by Nathan Clark and launched in 1950, to the iconic Wallabee, each design has an instantly recognizable signature that makes it unmistakably Clarks.

This season, we’re proud to introduce the Clarks Collective: five incredible activists championing authentic social change. From mental health awareness and LGBTQ+ rights to greater racial equality, these trailblazers are committed to creating a brighter future for us all – bringing to life Clarks’ new global campaign, For the World Ahead. Through spotlighting their stories and supporting their chosen charities and initiatives, we’re ready to lead the way. After all, we’re originators, not imitators. It’s who we are, who we’ve always been. And to change the world of tomorrow, we’re doing things differently today.

Clarks International believes that the principle of equality of opportunity is fundamental to the company's operations. Our long held aim is to provide just and fair treatment for all employees. We will not discriminate on the grounds of sex, age, disability, marital status, colour, race, religion, ethnic origin, sexual orientation or gender reassignment.

Title: Vice President, Human Resources
Job Description:
Position: Vice President, Human Resources (CalvertHealth – Prince Frederick, MD 20678)
Are you passionate in your role as a human resource professional? Do you seek career opportunities as a Vice President of Human Resources? Do you want to work with a compassionate, caring team whose culture and vision is to “make a difference in every life we touch”? If the answers are “yes”, we have an exciting opportunity for you at CalvertHealth located in Southern MD.
Why CalvertHealth:
CalvertHealth was established over 100 years ago and remains an independent, non-profit community hospital committed to providing safe, quality patient care. Prince Frederick, MD is a bayside community which offers the best of rural living with easy access to urban resources. Surrounded by water, Calvert County offers the tranquility of the Chesapeake Bay while at the same time is within 40 minutes of Washington, DC and Annapolis, MD.
What You Will Need:
Master’s in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related fields
10+ years of progressive leadership experience
PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP or other related certification preferred
In-depth knowledge about Human Resource processes and best practices, employment legislation, and legal regulations
Understanding and experience with Employer Branding and Recruitment Marketing strategies
Excellent knowledge of all aspects of HR management and experience with HRIS systems and recruiting software
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on organization’s success
What You Will Do:
Lead the HR, Employee Health, Education and Training, and Community Wellness teams to deliver strategic programs and operational support within the organization and community
Partner with the executive leadership team to analyze and prioritize the critical business challenges faced by the organization
Provide strategic HR and talent guidance and recommendations to the executive team
Deploy appropriate HR interventions to limit risk
Implement talent and development programs
Oversee the design, selection, and administration of all employee benefit, payroll, health, and safety programs
Oversee education and training programs and work with community partners to develop community wellness programs to meet the health needs of Calvert County
Lead employee engagement efforts to create the desired workplace culture which fosters an engaged and productive workforce
Partner with other leaders to support business performance, quality, and patient care initiatives
Responsible for developing, designing, forecasting, budgeting, and comparing programs and financial data in order to develop quality programs that operate within department budgets
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $200,000.00 - $250,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Employee assistance program
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance

Professional development assistance
Retirement plan
Tuition reimbursement
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday
On call
Ability to commute/relocate:
Prince Frederick, MD 20678: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
Application Question(s):
Do you have a minimum of one Covid-19 vaccine of a one-dose vaccine or both doses of a two-dose vaccine series?

Title: Human Resources Assistant
Job Description:
Human Resources Assistant
Title of Position: Human Resources Assistant

Reports to: Director of Human Resources

Job Type: Full-Time

Location: Remote (preferably EST or CST time zone)

Hours: Monday - Friday, 9:00 am - 5:00 pm


Position Summary:
EforAll is growing and hiring a support professional to handle daily administrative tasks for the Human Resources team. The Human Resources Assistant will ensure effective and efficient operations by supporting functions related to employee onboarding, benefits administration, and upkeep of employee and employer records and files. Maintaining the integrity and confidentiality of the human resource files and records are essential to this position.

Responsibilities:

Benefits Administration:
Ensuring compliance and benefits administration is efficient and accurate with great attention to detail.
Monitoring premiums and tracking appropriate administration of benefits.
Assists with planning and execution of special events such as benefits enrollment, org-wide retreat planning, and employee recognition events.
Employee and Employer Files:
Maintaining complete, accurate, and up-to-date employee files.
Updating and maintaining various onboarding and financial-related spreadsheets.
Provides clerical support to the HR department.
Onboarding:
Conducts and assists with new hire orientation and welcome meetings.
Facilitates completion of paperwork.
Employee file management.
Answers frequently asked questions from applicants and employees relative to onboarding, HR system inquiries, and standard policies and procedures.
Completes I-9 verifications through E-Verify.
Knowledge/Experience/Skills/Abilities:
Exceptional written and verbal communication.
Proficient with google suite.
Interpersonal with the ability to manage sensitive and confidential information with tact, professionalism, and diplomacy.
Organizational skills and attention to detail.
Excellent time management skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
The ability to self-manage.
Comfortable working in a remote environment.
Bilingual (Spanish) preferred but not required.
